name: SBT GRVL 75
terrain_description: Mountain gravel roads with sustained climbs, technical descents, and stunning Colorado scenery
description: SBT GRVL is Steamboat Springs' premier gravel race, featuring challenging mountain terrain, significant climbing, and the stunning backdrop of the Yampa Valley. The 75-mile course delivers a proper test of fitness with enough distance to require smart pacing and solid fueling.
key_challenges: sustained climbing at altitude, technical gravel descents, variable weather, and managing effort across 5500ft of elevation gain
weather_strategy: Mountain weather is unpredictable. Check forecast, pack arm warmers and vest. Morning starts can be cold, afternoon thunderstorms possible.
aid_station_strategy: Well-supported course. Quick stops for refills. Don't rely solely on aid stations - carry enough between stops.
altitude_power_loss: Significant - race is at 6,700-8,500 feet elevation. Expect 5-10% power loss vs sea level. Acclimatize if possible.
specific_skill_notes: Practice descending on loose gravel. The course has technical sections where confidence matters. Train on similar terrain if available.
specific_tactics: Start conservatively - the altitude will catch up with you. The climbing is relentless so pace yourself. Save legs for the back half.

race_characteristics.typical_weather: Variable. Cold mornings, warm afternoons, possible afternoon thunderstorms. Be prepared for anything.

race_hooks.punchy: Colorado mountain gravel at its finest.
race_hooks.detail: SBT GRVL delivers a proper mountain gravel experience - challenging climbs, technical descents, and scenery that makes you forget the suffering. The 75-mile course is the sweet spot: long enough to require real fitness, short enough to push hard.

race_significance.iconic_status: a rapidly growing premier mountain gravel event
race_significance.organization_quality: excellent - professional organization with small-town charm
race_significance.community: Steamboat's cycling community creates a festive atmosphere
race_significance.field_depth: strong regional field with national talent
race_significance.travel_lodging: Steamboat is a destination town - book early, lodging fills up

guide_variables.race_terrain: mountain gravel roads with sustained climbs

non_negotiables.why: Racing at 7,000+ feet without acclimatization will significantly impact performance
Precise power data is critical for pacing at altitude where RPE is unreliable
The course has technical sections - confidence on descents prevents crashes and saves energy
Simulating race conditions prepares your body for the stress of altitude
Altitude increases calorie burn - nail your fueling or bonk hard
